subsections.title: Active Chits
subsections.content: Active Chits – See In Play Chits.

subsections.title: Assigned
subsections.content: Assigned – A denizen is assigned if it is on a character's or other denizen's sheet attacking him, or if it is on its own sheet being attacked by a character or other denizens.

subsections.title: Attention Chit
subsections.content: Attention Chit – The action chit which has the character symbol on one side and is blank on the other.

subsections.title: Beast
subsections.content: Beast – A Frog, Squirrel, Bird, Eagle, Lion, or Dragon created by the Transform spell.

subsections.title: Cave Clearing
subsections.content: Cave Clearing – A clearing that is in a cave.

subsections.title: Caves Tile
subsections.content: Caves Tile – Any tile with at least one cave on it, in which treasure sites can appear.

subsections.title: Character
subsections.content: Character – One of the 16 adventurer types that can be played by a player. Described on the character cards.

subsections.title: Chit
subsections.content: Chit – The smallest square counters, including action chits, sound chits, warning chits, site chits, Lost City and Lost Castle chits, Monster Roll, Day (Turn), Weather chits, visitor chits, and number chits.

subsections.title: Counter
subsections.content: Counter – Any game piece other than the hex tiles, character cards, and chits.

subsections.title: Creature
subsections.content: Creature – A beast or monster.

subsections.title: Denizen
subsections.content: Denizen – A monster or native of the Magic Realm.

subsections.title: Garrison Natives
subsections.content: Garrison Natives – Native groups that start out on the map at a dwelling, including the Order, Guard, Soldiers, and Rogues.

subsections.title: Hired Leaders
subsections.content: Hired Leaders – The HQ of each native group. When hired, the HQ gets a turn just like a character. Controlled monsters also play like hired leaders.

subsections.title: Hirelings
subsections.content: Hirelings – Any denizen who is hired by a character, including hired leaders, underlings, and hired monsters.

subsections.title: In Play Chits
subsections.content: In Play Chits – Any chit that can be played during Daylight or Evening for any purpose. Includes regular action chits that are not fatigued or wounded and enchanted color chits.

subsections.title: Minion
subsections.content: Minion – Any native or monster that is hired or controlled by a character.

subsections.title: Mountain Clearing
subsections.content: Mountain Clearing – A clearing that has ridges drawn around it on a mountain tile; not every clearing on a mountain tile is a mountain clearing.

subsections.title: Mountain Tile
subsections.content: Mountain Tile – A tile with at least one mountain clearing in which treasure sites can appear. Also includes the Deep Woods tile (even though there are no mountains in it) to round out the 5 Mountain tiles, along with the 5 Cave tiles, in which treasure sites can appear.

subsections.title: Native
subsections.content: Native – A member of a native group which can be hired, traded with, or battled.

subsections.title: Out of Play Chits
subsections.content: Out of Play Chits – Action chits that are unavailable for use during Daylight or Evening activities. Includes fatigued chits, wounded chits, and Magic chits dedicated to spells.

subsections.title: Player
subsections.content: Player – A person who plays one of the characters. A distinction between the character and the player is made in some rules.

subsections.title: Prowling
subsections.content: Prowling – The denizens that are prowling each day are those in the row corresponding to the day's Monster Roll. Prowling denizens will move from the Appearance Chart to the playing board if summoned by game chits, and prowling monsters will move within their hex tile when characters and hired leaders finish their turn.

subsections.title: Underlings
subsections.content: Underlings – Hired natives who are not leaders (HQs) and hired monsters. Underlings do not get turns of their own and can only follow characters or hired leaders.

subsections.title: Visitors
subsections.content: Visitors – One of the four individuals that can appear on the board when Row 6 is prowling. Can be traded with but not hired or battled.

subsections.title: Woods Clearing
subsections.content: Woods Clearing – Any clearing that is not a cave or mountain clearing.
